sections.title: Description
sections.raw_content:
Creates a new sprite from a picture specified by picID. The sprite starts invisible and should be given a depth using Sprite.SetHeight and a position, given Sprite.SetPosition before being made visible using Sprite.Show. When you are finished using the sprite, the sprite should be freed using Sprite.Free.

Sprites work best when they are of moderate size. Large sprites will cause flashing when moved across the screen.

Anything that is is color 0 in the picture will not appear when the sprite is drawn. In other words, color 0 is transparent. (This is by default. You can set the transparent color for a sprite by setting the picture's transparent colour using Pic.SetTransparentColor.
sections.text_content:
Creates a new sprite from a picture specified by picID. The 
          sprite starts invisible and should be given a depth using 
          Sprite.SetHeight and a position, given Sprite.SetPosition 
          before being made visible using Sprite.Show. When you are 
          finished using the sprite, the sprite should be freed using 
          Sprite.Free.
          
          Sprites work best when they are of moderate size. Large sprites will 
          cause flashing when moved across the screen.
          
          Anything that is is color 0 in the picture will not appear when the 
          sprite is drawn. In other words, color 0 is transparent. (This is by
          default. You can set the transparent color for a sprite by setting
          the picture's transparent colour using
          Pic.SetTransparentColor.
sections.mdown_content:
Creates a new sprite from a picture specified by *picID*. The sprite starts invisible and should be given a *depth* using **Sprite.SetHeight** and a position, given **Sprite.SetPosition** before being made visible using **Sprite.Show**. When you are finished using the sprite, the sprite should be freed using **Sprite.Free**.
Sprites work best when they are of moderate size. Large sprites will cause flashing when moved across the screen.
Anything that is is color 0 in the picture will not appear when the sprite is drawn. In other words, color 0 is transparent. (This is bydefault. You can set the transparent color for a sprite by settingthe picture's transparent colour using**[pic_settransparentcolor.html](Pic.SetTransparentColor)**.

sections.title: Example
sections.text_content: See Sprite.Animate for an example of Sprite.New.

sections.title: Status
sections.raw_content:
Exported qualified.

This means that you can only call the function by calling Sprite.New, not by calling New.
sections.text_content:
Exported qualified.
          This means that you can only call the function by calling 
	  Sprite.New, not by calling New.
sections.mdown_content:
Exported qualified.
This means that you can only call the function by calling **Sprite.New**, not by calling **New**.
